> <OLD>
>
> Perceptor disgused his signature as Autobot and started to
> sc=
an the computer ready to act.

<NEW>

As Perceptor attempted to disguise hi=
s signature a small alert began to be
transmitted, until Legacy stepped for=
ward and entered a short set of
commands.

=93After we had determined that =
the Predacons had ways of disguising their
signatures I had implanted sever=
al fail safes into the computer scanning
system.=94 Legacy said to Percepto=
r, his voice as cold and impassive as ever.
=93The computer will accept you=
r entries for a limited time.=94 Legacy stepped
over to the other controls,=
 =93It will be up to Rodimus Prime and Tuscon as to
whether your security s=
tatus will be made more permanent.=94


> <OLD>
>
> At the sight of the bom=
b, Quickstride gets a good look at the bomb's inner
workings, and recognize=
s the wiring. Although it looked to be assembled
differently, he could actu=
ally make out what needed to be done and quickly
goes to work on the defusi=
ng aspect of the bomb.
>
> "Ahh, here we go, yep, the wiring is all the sam=
e as I remember it, just
configured differently around the bomb's inner pow=
er core and timing device.
Okay Wing Caliber, first things first, we need t=
a snip the cable that runs
from the battery pack to the explosive compound,=
 which is the blue and white
wire I'm pointing to, on my left. That will cu=
t the power off to the main
explosive. After that, the counter will mean no=
thing, unless of course that
slag ball managed to do a bypass on it.. Let's=
 see... Checking for a... Son
of a... SLAG! There is a bypass on this. I ha=
te that. I know how ta do this
but it's a pain in the aft ta do it. Okay, h=
ere goes nothing.. Stupid pred
/minion whatever the slag this creep is."

<=
NEW>

Wing Caliber nodded as he stood at one of the controls looking at a c=
omputer
console. =93I have the schematic down here.=94 He said to Quickstri=
de. =93You will
have to disengage the bypass. To do that you will have to d=
o it manually
with a polarized microcrimp.=94

Stepping over to a small cab=
inet, obviously where there is a repair kit for
bridge computer work, Wing =
Caliber reached in and retrieved a tool. =93If you
don=92t have one, we hav=
e one here.=94

=93Be careful.=94 Wing Caliber said, =93You will have to cu=
t it all off at the
same time while cutting power to the system.=94


> <OL=
D>
>
> At the site of the door, Uproar's finest of weaponry were his claws,=
 even
more so in robot mode. He charges at the door, in robot mode, and pre=
pares
to unleash his powerful claw attack, hoping to tear the door to shrea=
ds.

<NEW>

The door actually gives way under Uproars powerful assault. The=
 door already
partially damaged by the intruders explosion that wedged it t=
here, Uproar=92s
claws make quick work of the rest of it.

=93Good work Upr=
oar!=94 Leo II said as he nodded approvingly at Uproar, the door
laying in =
large slashed pieces.

=93Leo! BEAST MODE!=94 the maximal said as Leo shift=
ed into his large
transmetalled lion mode. =93COME ON!=94 he said to Uproar=
 as he took off down
the hall, letting off a large roar as he ran!

> <OLD>=

>
> elita continued Running and jumping trying to avoid the shots,
> prayi=
ng to someone comes to help her soon. She didnt know but
> she did a wrong =
turn and the corritor was large but has a dead
> end

<NEW>

The intruder c=
ontinued to give chase, flying after the fleeing Elita, with a
quiet menaci=
ng laughter. As Elita quickly began to realize her error as she
could see t=
he end of her corridore the intruder landed several meters from
her, lookin=
g like some cold shadow in the darkness. His optics sparkled
wickedly.

=93=
I believe your time for running is over.=94 He said as he began to move
tow=
ards her! That is until the sound of something else could be heard in the
h=
alls.

> =93. . . ELITA, WE'RE COMMING, HANG IN THERE!"

It was the sound o=
f Uproar=92s voice echoing along the halls. Then there was
the sound of a l=
arge roar.

=93FRELL!=94 the intruder whispered in annoyance. =93I don=92t =
have time for this.=94
He looked at Elita and then back up the hall and the=
n back at Elita, =93You
will live. But I will come back for you another tim=
e my pretty, yes, and
then we shall talk, we shall talk at length.=94

The =
intruder laughed and then disappeared as if fading into the shadows.

MEANW=
HILE OUTSIDE:

Tuscon and the rest of the crew arrive at the Ark. So far no=
thing seems
undamaged. Silverbolt and Noctorro are flying around, so far un=
able to
penetrate the shielding of the Ark.

=93GREAT!=94 Noctorro said to =
Tuscon and Torca in his deep booming voice. =93We
still can=92t get in.=94
=

=93Yes. The vile Predacon still holds us at bay.=94 Silverbolt added.



S=
ome distance away, hidden from sensors Hydras and the sweeps watch this all=

with apparent interest. The sweeps continue to stay close to Hydras to blo=
ck
him from radar and sensors. So long as no one comes over the rise, he wi=
ll
remain hidden.

=93I am ready to vacate.=94 A message comes from Blackra=
zor to Hydras. =93I
believe I have a small present for the maximals.=94 The=
re is a small evil
chuckle.

(OOC: I am not sure exactly where Hydras has h=
idden himself, but I will
assume that it not easily visable, although Hydra=
s should be able to see the
group of approaching Maximals and Autobots.)

(=
TAG)

Preston
